title: Giuliani Ordered to Pay $148 million to Georgia Election Workers Over 2020 Election Lies
description: There was an audible gasp in the courtroom.

title: What to Know About Zack Snyder’s Action-Packed Space Epic Rebel Moon
description: The Zack Snyder space epic follows a band of rebels who join forces to rise up against the brutal and tyrannical Motherworld empire.

title: American Fiction Is a Breezy Satire Anchored by a Remarkable Jeffrey Wright
description: Cord Jefferson's new satire lacks the bite of the novel it's based on, but Wright's performance makes it a complex pleasure.

title: Wonka Is, Respectfully, a Little Too Much
description: The charm offensive that is 'Wonka' toils way too hard for its meager pleasures. It may leave you feeling more worked over than invigorated.

title: How Wonka Handles the Controversial History of Roald Dahl’s Oompa-Loompas
description: The prequel film puts its own spin on the origin of the relationship between Willy Wonka and the Oompa-Loompas.

title: IDF Mistakenly Kills 3 Hostages in Gaza Ground Operation
description: An IDF spokesman said Israeli troops found the hostages and erroneously identified them as a threat.

title: The 10 Most Viral Moments of 2023
description: From Barbenheimer to SpongeBob AI to countless feuds, here are the year's biggest Internet moments.

title: The 3 Most Important AI Policy Milestones of 2023
description: From President Biden's executive order on AI to the E.U. AI Act, governments scrambled to catch up and regulate AI this year.

title: Ukrainian Council Member Throws Grenades During Meeting, Injuring 26
description: A Ukrainian village council member threw grenades on the floor during a meeting, harming 26 people, according to local authorities.

title: Al Jazeera Journalist Whose Family Was Killed in Airstrike Is Wounded in Gaza
description: Al Jazeera journalists Wael Dahdouh and Samer Abudaqa were wounded in what is believed was an Israeli drone attack in Gaza on Friday.

title: The 25 Most Anticipated Books of 2024
description: From RuPaul's memoir to a posthumous novel by Gabriel García Márquez.

title: What Palestinian Children Face in Israeli Prisons
description: Under Israel's draconian military laws, Palestinian children are systemically imprisoned—often for throwing stones. Here's what they face in detention.

title: The Dangers of Curtailing Free Speech on Campus
description: The response to growing antisemitism on campus can't be to restrict speech, argues Suzanne Nossel.

title: The Message COP28 Just Sent the Business World
description: Now that COP28 has wrapped, it’s useful to ask: what is the market signal that emerged in Dubai?

title: The Government Finally Did Something About Robocalls
description: Automated telemarketing calls are driving Americans crazy. The FCC is finally doing something about it.

title: How My Journey From Fisherman to Filmmaker Led to Finestkind
description: Oscar-winning screenwriter Brian Helgeland on the inspiration behind his new movie starring Tommy Lee Jones and Jenna Ortega.

title: That Texas Abortion Case Is Even Worse Than You Think
description: Texas has multiple abortion bans, creating a legal and medical minefield for Kate Cox.

title: What We Lose When We Can’t Stargaze
description: 'What do we lose when our connection with our cosmic environment is broken,' asks Roberto Trotta.

title: Prince Harry Wins Partial Victory in Hacking Case Against U.K. Newspaper Group
description: Prince Harry has been awarded £140,600 in damages, as the judge ruled that newspaper directors "turned a blind eye" to unlawful gathering of information.

title: Calling Out Terrorism Shouldn’t Be an Issue of Free Speech
description: Diversity must not just be predicated on identity but also on ideas. America’s campuses must live up to these ideals, writes Bruce Hoffman.

title: Southwest Praised for Giving Free Extra Seats: How U.S. Airlines Handle Plus-Sized Passengers
description: Southwest has been praised for its more inclusive policy for plus-sized passengers. Here’s how other major U.S. airlines approach the issue.

title: 515 People Injured in Train Collision in Beijing
description: The accident occurred Thursday evening in Beijing’s mountainous west on an above-ground portion of the city’s sprawling subway system.

title: Hong Kong Expands Hunt for Overseas Democracy Activists With More Bounties
description: Hong Kong police accused five more activists of violating a Beijing-imposed national security law and offered significant bounties for info leading to their arrests.

title: Google Will Stop Providing Law Enforcement Data on Which Users Were Near a Crime
description: The company said location data will soon be saved directly on users’ devices, blocking Google from seeing it and, by extension, blocking law enforcement demanding that information.
